question: The following data fragment occurs in the middle of a data stream for which the bytestuffing algorithm described in the text is used: A B ESC C ESC FLAG FLAG D. What is the output after stuffing?
reference_answer: A B ESC ESC C ESC ESC ESC FLAG ESC FLAG D
model_response:
The following data fragment occurs in the middle of a data stream for which the bytestuffing algorithm described in the text is used: A B ESC C ESC FLAG FLAG D. What is the output after stuffing? A. A B ESC C ESC D B. A B ESC C ESC ESC D C. A B ESC C ESC ESC ESC D D. A B ESC C ESC ESC ESC ESC D
The following data fragment occurs in the middle of a data stream for which the bytestuffing algorithm described in the text is used: A B ESC C ESC FLAG FLAG D. What is the output after stuffing? A. A B ESC C ESC D B. A B ESC C ESC ESC D C. A B ESC C ESC ESC ESC D D. A B ESC C ESC ESC ESC ESC D

question: What is the maximum overhead in byte-stuffing algorithm?
reference_answer:
The maximum overhead occurs when the payload consists of only ESC and
FLAG bytes. In this case, there will be 100% overhead.
model_response:
What is the maximum overhead in byte-stuffing algorithm? [closed]
I have to implement the byte-stuffing algorithm for my assignment, and I have to find the maximum overhead in byte-stuffing. I know that the maximum overhead is the number of bytes added to the original message. But I'm not sure how to calculate it.
closed with the note: Please do not use this site to ask for homework help; this is not what the site is for. –  Community ♦ May 17 '17 at 11:25
If you have to find the maximum overhead in byte-stuffing, then you must be given a specific message to stuff. If not, then there is no maximum overhead. If you are given a message, then the maximum overhead is the length of the message after stuffing divided by the length of the original message.
